DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_FlightLog1: BEGIN FLIGHTLOG: <![CDATA[<color=orange>Escape Pod 5</color>]]>. <![CDATA[<color=orange>Vessel</color>]]> has been mortally injured. Emergency sequence activated. Awaiting departure from <![CDATA[<color=orange>Vessel</color>]]>.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_FlightLog2:
WARNING: Launch obstructed. Cannot safely-
Now launching <![CDATA[<color=orange>Escape Pod 5</color>]]>.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_FlightLog3: ALERT: Uncontrolled warp detected. Significant damage to pod detected.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_FlightLog4: ALERT: Collision imminent. Preparing for impact.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_FlightLog5: Scanning external environment... Scan complete. Stellar radiation is prohibitively high. Verdict: INHOSPITABLE. Do not seek shelter on planet surface.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording1: KEEK: Is... well, is everyone else]]> unharmed?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording2: ALLIUM: I believe so, yes. We are no more injured than you.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording3: FOLI: Rest now, let me treat your burns.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording4: MUSA: It appears the four of us are the only passengers.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording5: ALLIUM: Better than no passengers. You have my gratitude, Keek.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording6: MUSA: I’ll go set out the distress signal.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording7: FOLI: Move swiftly; this planet is approaching periapsis, where it is most vulnerable to the <![CDATA[<color=lightblue>red dwarf star</color>]]>.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording8: ALLIUM: You can wait until night, actually. This planet’s eccentricity prevented it from becoming tidally locked.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording_21: KEEK: We have decided to relocate to one of the poles. I’m not sure which one it will be, the magnetic field is too chaotic to tell.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording_22: ALLIUM: Well we are heading in the pod’s aft direction regardless.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording_23: FOLI: The radiation will be less intense, which will hopefully increase our chances of survival.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_CrashSiteRecording_24: MUSA: It will also be ideal for celestial observations. We could assess this star system and what to do next.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_DistressSignalNote1: MUSA: Given the lack of other distress signals, I’m not confident ours will be heard either.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_PB_EscapePod_DistressSignalNote2: MUSA: I fear my upcoming strive to pinpoint our location will be in vain, and that the warp has already sealed our fate...
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo01: Why, hello traveler! What brings you to <![CDATA[<color=lightblue>Europa</color>]]>?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo11: Ah right, the vents melted through the ice down there. Must be pretty from the outside.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo21: What can I do for you?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo2A: I met all of your children.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo2C: Is there any other life in this solar system?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo2D: Are we safe from the meteors?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo31: Have you met my eleven children? Well one’s away, but still, they’re quite something.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo41: Indeed, out at <![CDATA[<color=lightblue>Enceladus</color>]]>. A son of mine married a fine lad from there. Oh and <![CDATA[<color=lightblue>Earth</color>]]> too, I suppose. Not much is left there though.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo51: Ah yes, don’t worry about <![CDATA[<color=lightblue>Io</color>]]>. The ice takes a beating, but it holds. Outside is a different story, but you’re welcome to stay here.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gustavo61: You- all of them? Really? Well I suppose it’s an achievement, but I respect your tolerance.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_EuropaIntro22: As you can see, the heat from tidal forces maintains this ocean below the ice.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_EuropaIntro23: It’s pretty nice here, although I do wonder what’s beyond the shell.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_GarryGustavo11: Dad’s at the north pole, yeah.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_GarryGustavo22: He’s giant, you can’t miss him.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_GarryGeysers1: Not much, just warming up by these vents.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_GarryExplore1: Well there’s not much going on with Europa, most of the vents are dormant right now.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_GarryExplore2: You could go talk to Dad at the north pole though, he likes visitors.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Geoffrey11: Have you ever thought “hey, I am a thing that exists”? It’s wild. You are a something, and I am also a something.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Geoffrey12: Does that mean we’re both the same thing? But that would also mean we’re the same thing as everything.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Geoffrey13: Am I a toothbrush? I mean, I’m a jellyfish. I have no clue what teeth are. But am I a toothbrush?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Griffin11: I like tea. Tea is good.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Griffin12: Sometimes I come back from my jellyjob, and I’m really stressed.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Griffin13: But when I take a sip of some tea, it all goes away.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Griffin14: Granted, it’s rather difficult to drink a liquid while being underwater, and to acquire it from a teapot in deep space.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Griffin15: But I do like some tea.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gertrude11: Greetings! May the Holy Shell be with you.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gertrude21: Do you not know the way of the Teapot?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gertrude31: Goodness, you must be so lost without It!
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gertrude32: Russell's Teapot cast The Holy Shell around the ocean to protect us from the demons of Io!
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gertrude33: No one can disprove Russell's Teapot, for It is too small to see as It orbits somewhere between Earth and Mars.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gooseberry32: Why do they call it oven when you of in the cold food of out hot eat the food?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gooseberry33: Cookies are baked and bacon is cooked.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gooseberry34: Maybe the real Eye of the universe was the friends we made along the way.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gooseberry35: All problems can and should be solved with arson.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gideon12: COFFEE IS THE BEST THING EVER.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gideon13: <![CDATA[<size=40>WHEN I SLEEP FOR THIRTEEN HOURS STRAIGHT AND I NEED TO WAKE UP I JUST NEED SOME COFFEE.</size>]]>
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gideon14: <![CDATA[<size=45>AND BY SOME I MEAN 34 INDUSTRIAL CONTAINERS FULL OF RAW COFFEE BEANS.</size>]]>
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gideon15: <![CDATA[<size=50>COFFEE IS THE BEST THING EVER I LOVE IT SO MUCH I’D LITERALLY JUST STOP EXISTING WITHOUT COFFEE MY BLOOD IS NOW COFFEE I’M SERIOUS IF A VAMPIRE BIT ME THEY’D GET SUPER ENERGETIC CUZ MY BLOOD IS MADE OF COFFEE.</size>]]>
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gideon17: <![CDATA[<size=20>One sec ima go get some coffee...</size>]]>
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gregory11: Hey, you're from space, right? I've always wanted to see the stars.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gregory1A: Well they're not doing too good...
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gregory21: Oh, well, I hope they get better soon.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gerald11: Did you know that water is the most lethal substance ever?
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gerald12: Yeah, 100% of things that consume water die.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gerald13: So, stop drinking water. Also, stop breathing. That one also has a 100% mortality rate.
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gerald21: Oh styx oh phocis oh my ganymede oh no what will I do oh no dear zeus oh no-
DialogueDictionary.RSS_Gerald22: Wait, I know what to do!

RSS_FindVesselWormhole.Name: The Other Side
RSS_FindVesselWormhole.Description: Find another swirly thing by a broken thing.
